website_summaries.verdict: Moves smaller files quickly and easily – a quality choice for a homework drive.
pros: Sliding cap design offers best of both worlds: the protection and safety of a lid without the fear of losing it
We like the black matte design as well
Takes slightly longer, especially when moving large files (4 GB and up), but it's hardly noticeable
No issues at all when moving a bunch of little files all at once
cons: Writes a bit more slowly than some of the other Kingston models

customer_reviews.title: Speed - Read Carefully!
customer_reviews.text: It is written there, DataTraveler 100 G3 [16GB–128GB] has speeds: 100MB/s read, 10MB/s write. That being said, how can MFG claim 'delivers impressive USB 3.0 speeds and is backwards compatible with USB 2.0 ports.' Maybe it was a mistake, and it should have been: 'delivers impressive USB 2.0 speeds and is compatible with USB 3.0 ports.'
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeFromRo

customer_reviews.title: READ THE REVIEWS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the price. Does it store stuff? Yeah. It is literally the slowest USB device I have EVER connected. DO NOT BUY THIS UNLESS you ONLY want a USB drive to put things on for long term off computer storage. If you plan to use it as a portable drive you can forget about it. It's pointless. FWIW I have a PC with M.2 and SSD storage only. This is plugged into a USB 3.1 port. It has NO excuse to move data at 7.xx mb per second. It is 5.5 times SLOWER than my el cheapo SanDisk.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Bad for Kingston
customer_reviews.text: Flash drive failed after 1 year. Kingston support asked for serial number. Serial number is not present, I think it was vanished because of the use (i've read similar situations). Kingston said product is not original so no warranty or support. Bad for Kingston, they know I bought the item direct from Amazon, Thanks Amazon for the support.
customer_reviews.author: DonSenen

customer_reviews.title: Avoid, slow and error prone.
customer_reviews.text: All USB Flash storage devices have a fair share of 1 star reviews so I bought 2 64GB from 2 manufactures just in case: Kingston (this one) and SanDIsk  . Under the same setup (i.e. plugged sequentially into the same USB port) and for the same task (copy 30G worth of audio files) the Kingston one failed miserably: it took 10 hrs to complete, couldn't be unmounted (ejected) cleanly and some files were corrupted. Whereas the SanDisk completed in less than 2 hrs, error free. I will not buy Kingston in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not even USB2.0 write speed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 64GB sticks. Both write at less than a quarter the speed of my Sandisk stick. I wish I had read these reviews first before buying. I have a 16GB version of this that I bought 2-3 years ago that is fast, so I thought this would be fast too. I can't believe Kingston would put their name on such a mediocre product. One star instead of no stars because it basically works.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not functional, terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I mean, they *CHANGED TO DON'T WORK*. I get >8mbps sequential writes and .1-.3mbps random writes... Unfortunately, advertising these as 'usb 3.0' means nothing because the onboard storage wouldn't be limited by a serial connector, nevermind usb 2. For the money, I bought 10 and won't have to worry about it again, but I can't wait until manufacturers either stop intentionally misleading or start providing us with actual usb 3 speed capable flash drives. Or, heck, even usb 2 speed compatible. (60 mbytes/s) Edit: I bought 10 and five of them were trash. Are you being serious? Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Slow, like its' competitors.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. Neither could sustain writes from a 3.1, 3.0, or 2.0 port. Within seconds, throughput dropped to near zero. Kingston had better check its quality control or lose its good name. In the last several days, I have bought Kingston, Samsung, and now SanDisk 32 GB USB 3.0 and 3.1 thumb drives. On a known, good host that drives older SanDisk drives over 50 MB/sec, these all run at a fraction of that speed. The question in my mind is whether the manufacturers now they are shipping defective hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scheer

customer_reviews.title: End-of-write failed
customer_reviews.text: I was creating a Windows 10 install media drive. The Windows Installation Media Tool successfully completed pre-configuration, download but in the very last stage, when it tried to do a check, an unknown failure happened. I tried this 3 times, on two USB flash drives (I had bought 4 of these USB flash drives) -- all failed. I have successfully used one of these flask drives for regular file copy. So it seems that these drives can only handle very basic things. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Pratan

customer_reviews.title: Very slow for a USB-3 standard
customer_reviews.text: Don't fall for the low price like I did.. This device is very slow for the usb 3 standard, I have other flash drive that is 5 times faster than this one.
customer_reviews.author: V.K.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Read, Horrible Write Speeds, especially for a USB 3.1 drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought several inexpensive 16Gb drives to use for Windows 10 Install. The Kingston 16 Gb DataTraveler 100 had decent read speeds, but the write speeds were slower than older USB 2.0 drives. The speeds are shown in the attached capture from Crystal Disk Mark testing the drive inserted into a USB 3.0 port in my desktop PC. I suppose for under $4, this is an acceptable drive to be used where frequent writing isn't needed, but rather used as a drive to read from. However, I'd try something else if I needed to both read and write at USB 3.0 speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Doug C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I've had a few products from this brand. But I was extremely surprised and shocked how extremely slow this USB data transfer was reading and writing. I stopped the process twice just to make sure my other drive wasn't malfunctioning. But it wasn't it was this product. I had no choice but to by a different brand USB. I ended up donating this to good Will. I hope Kingston upgraded this as it's an insult to their brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tree

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive due to the pricepoint. For a few bucks delivered, why not? The issue is that it while it did work for a couple weeks, it now is unreadable. Luckily, I just used it to transfer files that a family member didn't want uploaded/in the cloud. It was just a spare backup, so we had the original files. Had it been our only source, we would have been in severe trouble. I would recommend that you pass on this drive. There are so many options for so cheap, it isn't worth your time/money.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Lazenby

customer_reviews.title: Stopped reading after a very short time.
customer_reviews.text: Product was used sparingly over 2 months. about the 5th time I tried using it the drive would come up with an error that there was an issue and I should run the troubleshooter. When I did the message would come back and say it was not able to repair the drive. I understand this is a very low cost item, but I believe that shouldn't mean it should break after minimal usage. I also want to make it clear that I always eject the drive from my PC before removing it.
customer_reviews.author: PapaTech

customer_reviews.title: It is not USB3.0
customer_reviews.text: Did not perform as expected. Somewhere on the page it says "for capacities between 16GB–128GB: 100MB/s read, 10MB/s write." but you really have to dig for it. -- "10MB/s write" for a USB3.0 is not acceptable. Deceiving description, false advertising!
customer_reviews.author: C. G.

customer_reviews.title: This thumb drive acts more like a USB 1.1 device! HORRIBLY slow!
customer_reviews.text: DO.NOT.BUY.THIS.THUMB.DRIVE! Needed this thumb drive for a data recovery job. When I started copying data to it, I could not believe how slow it was. Over the course of the copy operations, I saw transfer speeds as low as 2.0 kB/sec and only as high as 200 kB/sec. I actually have a Kingston USB 2.0 thumb drive that transfer data much faster than this abomination. Either this is a) a gross case of false advertising by the manufacturer or seller, b) a defective unit (but with many other complaints of slow transfer speeds), or a counterfeit product. I sent this item back and bought a different unit. Not sure I will ever buy or recommend Kingston products again.
customer_reviews.author: RWard

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, buy a different USB
customer_reviews.text: These are awful, on 2 the speeds are total trash even compared to other budget USB drives and one died the 1st time I used it. I copied 28gb to 2 Silicon Power USBs in 8 minutes at the same time, the same exact data took 50 minutes for this one. Do yourself a favor and look into a better USB, Samsung ones are excellent but if you really need a cheap drive look elsewhere even for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Like everyone else. Drive Is Slow
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else this drive is slow. Drive varies between speed from 0 bytes to 24 MB/s within seconds, does not maintain a constant speed. I would not recommend this drive. Hard to use and hard to trust with the speeds it has. Hard to do much now but likely only to use from small things. Won't be able to get much out of it even though bought 2 for some files. Was expecting better than this. The only item that I didn't get a chance to read reviews I get something that is not great out of everything I buy. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L

customer_reviews.title: Product is junk
customer_reviews.text: This thumb drive hasnt' worked right from the beginning. But because I didn't open it until after the 30 day period when I discovered it didn't work right I contacted the seller ,J-Electronics, and asked to return for a refund. They turned me down. So I kept trying to get it to work but it isnt reliable and now it keeps ejecting when I put data on it, and the half-installed data wont delete off. This is $22.39 of my money wasted and I don't plan to buy from J-Electronics again because they did not take it back in the very beginning when I discovered it was defective. I'm also now leery of Kingston.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn H.

customer_reviews.title: A little over a month and its stuck read only now
customer_reviews.text: This drive worked maybe five or six times in the last month or so. I was using it to shuttle files from my work PC to my home PC. About half way through the last file copy it started failing to write. Whenever I plug it in now it's read only. The Kingston format tool doesn't help either. At least I was able to copy the data off the drive. With no return policy the 'really good deal' now really wasn't. At least it didn't eat the data on the drive.
customer_reviews.author: William Parish

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have used Kingston USB drives for many years and have found them to be outstanding. I don't know what happened to Kingston but this drive is pure crap! It is actually a replacement for the same model Kingston drive I received the previous day (hats off to Amazon's amazing customer service) . It took about 4 and a half hours to transfer 32.9GB to the drive, 15 seconds to open a 4KB folder, and 20 seconds just to eject the drive. If you're looking for a good USB drive, don't go for Kingston! The storage capacity is actually 115GB.
customer_reviews.author: RO

customer_reviews.title: Extreamly slow
customer_reviews.text: This review is for Kingston 32GB 100 G3 USB 3.0 DataTraveler. The drive is made of plastic casing that probably will not survive in pocket. It also does not cover the port hole and dust will accumulate there. I've attached the test results, but the real copy speed is about 3mb/s. When file is copied it variate in speed between 0 and 20mb/s. I have some cheaper China no-name drives that have way better performance. Should be OK for MP3 in car stereo, useless otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya Dan

customer_reviews.title: These USB 3.0 are mad slow which usb 1.0 is faster than this
customer_reviews.text: I am a photographer who uses USB flash drive to give finish photos to my clients so I am only using USB 3.0 or 3.1 to copy photos because of the size of each photo. These USB 3.0 flash drive took me couple hours to copy 4 GB of the photo. I have used another USB 3.0 drive to copy the same set of the photo which takes a couple mins to get 4GB of photos over. Therefore I am 100% that these usb 3.0 isn't 3.0 at all.
customer_reviews.author: LouisF

customer_reviews.title: Dismal Read/Write Speeds
customer_reviews.text: I started using this flash drive and noticed how long (22 minutes) it took to write 7 GBytes of data. I compared it to a much older USB 3.0 flash drive that I have, the latter took 9 minutes to write the same files. A flash drive speed utility confirmed my suspicion. My old drive's read speed is 70% faster, and write speed is 500% faster, than this Kingston drive. Dismal.
customer_reviews.author: Jam Meister

customer_reviews.title: Works as a Slow Flashdrive; That's about it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make a Windows Boot Disk, but my laptop won't recognize it at boot. I've made boot disks with some of my other drives and they all are detected. Also, as other reviewers have said, it's pretty slow for USB 3.0. UPDATE: Just bought an HP Flashdrive, which worked first try. Can confirm Kingston sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Murve

customer_reviews.title: Slow, slow, slow
customer_reviews.text: This thing is crap, the read write on this thing is awful. Read other reviews, even though they give it 3 stars they all say how slow this drive is.
customer_reviews.author: Derek T. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly slow write speeds
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was on sale, and I wanted to have another usb stick for OS installs. However, when flashing a boot ISO to the drive, it ran so slow that I gave up completely, used an older computer with an older flash drive, redownloaded the Linux ISO, and wrote it to the bootable USB drive all before this one had even reached 20% completion... The thing was cheap but not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: First One Was Defective
customer_reviews.text: Well, the first one I got was defective. When it was plugged into my Win PC, it caused disk management to lock up every time it was opened. On my Mac, the drive wouldn't even format. Amazon is shipping me another. When that one arrives, if it functions better than the first, I'll update this review. Update: Got the replacement from Amazon (not in short order, mind you) and the new drive works flawlessly. I was able to install Win10 on my newly built rig in about fifteen minutes and the drive doesn't get as hot as some others I've used. If you can avoid the defective ones, it's nifty little drive.
customer_reviews.author: Psychosmurf

customer_reviews.title: It has incredibly slow write speeds for 3.0
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews aren't lying about the write speeds, they have speeds compared to 2.0. That being said, other than that it's a nice little flash drive. If it would've cost more, I would've definitely given it a 1* but for the price and how much storage you get it's actually not bad, just don't expect 3.0 write speeds. The highest speed I saw through 10gb worth of data was 17mb/s, while the average was more like 5mb/s
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Cheap as beans
customer_reviews.text: I got these to throw some bootable usb sticks at my friends who needed a windows/linux installer. The write speeds are terrible, I should have got the usb 2.0 sandisk. oh well, they do work and are dirt cheap. Suitable for my purpose anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Leeland H.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe it was a 64GB flash drive for this price lol. It works well, and it's a USB 3.0- transfer speeds are fantastic as well! EDIT: Okay, so the listing says 64GB and the actual product says 64GB but my computer says it's a 32GB, even after formatting it, and now I an thoroughly displeased. I'm willing to change my review back to 5 stars if this can be fixed by the seller. :c EDIT 5/3/20 - Company sent free replacement! Unfortunately the 64GB is actually a 57GB, which is a 7GB loss, but whatever I'll take it, lol. Great customer service, at least!
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy. Speeds are trash, not worth the price at all. Spend 20% more for twice the drive
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, Kingston is now on my exile list. I’ve tried an SSD in the past that had speeds similar to a HDD, only having a small initial batch that met expectations before they moved to another factory and made inferior products under the same branding. This drive like others said, sure enough isn’t good even if it was usb 2.0. SO slow. I wouldn’t mind paying $1-2 each but I regret the couple dollars spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jerd Derk

customer_reviews.title: SLOW writing!
customer_reviews.text: SLOW writing! Transferred a video from SSD hard drive on fast laptop - never got above 10 mb/s. Most of the time went up and down between 7 mb/s and 0. Used a USB 3.0. Downloaded same video on another brand of flash drive. It averaged 21 mb/s same laptop, same port, same video. Read speed seems to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance, poor value
customer_reviews.text: I have probably a dozen flash drive. About half of them are 128 gig. This is the slowest 128 gig drive I have. After running 4-5 Crystal Disk tests on a USB 3.0 port I can assure you that you'll likely see read scores of 70-85mb/s and write scores of under 20mb/s. That's pretty poor for a USB 3.0 drive. For the $18-$20 that I spent on this three were a multitude of better options. Thumbs down 👇 👇 👇
customer_reviews.author: evmoore

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.  The product is slow but it meets the products expect results
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The product is slow but it meets the products expect results, I just wish kingston would step up their game and ship a faster product. But for $6 I guess what can I expect, although would be nice if they did release a faster product to get the competition to well compete so the consumer could get more for their money.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Failed after first use
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: The USB stick worked. Then it didn't. I did not have the energy to deal with returns. I did have the energy to write a lukewarm review. Pros: Cheap, sleek. Cons: Failed after first use. Unknowns: Speed? I would hope that data transfer is fast for this amount of data, but I just don't know if that is true.
customer_reviews.author: Ido Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Great for Win 10 Rescue Meduium
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for making a Win 10 Rescue USB. Windows said "Minimum 16 GB" so I was not sure it would work, but it did, taking up all 16 GB. A good price for Win 10 crash security because without this medium you are looking at about 2 days of hell if your system gets corrupted. Win 7 does not have this feature, so a simple CD / DVD will work, but it is simplistic at best. I ordered a 2-pack of the 32 GB just to 'have around".... Kingston seems to make a good product.
customer_reviews.author: TonyT in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Bogs computer down when inserted
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to state specs. I'm an end user, not a techie that does benchmark tests. Read the reviews before purchasing. These USB 3.0 thumb drives are horrible. I have a new system that does jsut fine with every other USB drive except these. Every time I plug it in my system freezes. It takes up to five minutes for it to load and transferring to / from them is just as bad. Pay more for a better product and avoid this brand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Cheap controller with lack luster performance
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of this drive was fairly OK. However it has a cheap PHISON controller in it and it shows. This drive is terrible at writes, especially random, and chugs at anything thats not small and basic. I wouldnt recommend it
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Real slow speeds and feels cheap in your hand
customer_reviews.text: God awfully slow and feels cheap and flimsy in the hand. But I mean soooooo slow idk how it can be called USB 3.0 but the write speed is terrible. I’m done with Kingston after this. Back to Patriot.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stirnweiss

customer_reviews.title: Does not run at USB 3.0 speed!
customer_reviews.text: This device struggles to write even at USB 2.0 speed. Whether copying many files or a single large file the max speed I ever got was 36MBps and even then it couldn't maintain that speed and would regularly fluctuate between single digit speeds and back up in to that 30MBps speed range. I actually returned the first one I received because after testing on multiple computers and with Linux as well as Windows I figured it must have been defective or even a counterfeit maybe but the replacement is no different. I'm a fan of Kingston and have their memory and solid state drives in every one of my laptops/desktops but this USB device is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: I was alarmed and surprised to read reviews about problems with thumb drives by almost all manufacturers. I had an old DataTraveler that performed just fine (as have a multitude of thumb drives in my possession) so I decided to give this one a try. Just fine for me. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Run4Fun

customer_reviews.title: Didn't make it past 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Something was wrong with mine. I hadn't used it for about a month or so and then went I tried to copy stuff to it, it was really slow. I had it plugged into the usb 3 on both my laptop and desktop. It was slow like 1992 dial up slow. All my other drives were normal. womp womp.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It is to slow
customer_reviews.text: My xbox one said the 3.0 128g was to slow to save games on. It was a waste of money since the flash drive was not fast enough. If your looking for flash drives to game save on the xbox one this is not the ones to get. They will not work with the xbox one!
customer_reviews.author: Marie K

customer_reviews.title: slow garbage
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had the other reviews before I bought this, mistakenly assuming all USB 3.0 drives would have about the same transfer rate. But no, this thing's transfer rate averages 9 MB/s, which is painfully slow. I plugged an ADATA USB 3.0 stick in the same port and copied the same files with an average rate of 45 MB/s, and a MicroCenter stick was averaging 36 MB/s - so it's not my system, it's the drive. Based on this experience, I'll never buy anything Kingston again, not when there are so many other better brands out there. Avoid this junk drive like the plague, and go with an ADATA, or any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: E. Roche

customer_reviews.title: This must be a Chinese knockoff.
customer_reviews.text: The write speed is slow. So slow. I wanted to copy 464.5MB to the drive from an internal SSD... It was reporting that it will take an hour to finish. Then 2 hours.. Now it's saying 3 hours and it's only copied 208.9MB. I plan on using it for a Commodore 64 so I'm not concerned about speed. However, I would never consider using this for any type of actual work.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Latino

customer_reviews.title: Kingston Always makes good memory products
customer_reviews.text: Kingston Digital 128GB DataTraveler is a good value for the money. The 128 GB appears to be the set standard for now. The memory stick is a little bigger than I wanted in terms of size. A competitor does make a similar size memory stick that is quite small and easy to use. However, I had catastrophic failer with that memory stick. Kingston has software that will recover and rejuvenate your memory stick should it be corrupted. That is why I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Earl Jackson III

customer_reviews.title: Great little music storage.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for making play lists with MP3s. I have several cars and can keep one in all of them. At sub $4 each, you can give them away. I had to make several this Christmas as friends kept asking for them. I'm sure there are faster and better ones but for the price, these are reliable and work just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: P. Theo

customer_reviews.title: awesome value
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have, and its probably true about most Kingston & PNY and probably other flash sticks, they are VERY SLOW to write, even when in 2.0 compatabilty, drops to about 4mbps, but speedy to read. It serves its purpose, and yes, I will buy it again. I recommend not using for a live OS boot if you expect lots of writes (for swap files, etc), But for storage of files its perfect. Its a tad power hungry on the USB port at 300mw.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Koehler

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 flash drive with USB 2.0 speed very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cheap USB 3.0 flash drive hoping to get better transfer speed because I'm going to install a live linux distribution on it. However after some file transfers and crystal disk mark testing it's really just a mediocre USB 2.0 speed drive. The ports I connect it to are all USB 3.0.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas C.

customer_reviews.title: horrible download speed worse than USB 1.0
customer_reviews.text: This must be a knockoff item that someone put the Kingston name on the package. Kingston would never put their name on this piece of garbage. Download speeds of about 1Mb/sec, not the 200MB/sec it should be getting if it were USB 3 or 3.1
customer_reviews.author: goatweed

customer_reviews.title: Slow and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had constant issues with mine, and I've used in a Mac, a custom gaming PC, and a gaming laptop (all USB 3 compatible) and the read and write speeds are very slow. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow, Skip this drive.
customer_reviews.text: I have more than 10 flash drives. Never encounter such a slow flash drive. Quality looks good until you plug it in your computer. Write speed is worse than a USB 1. What’s good does it do with high capacity when you hardly hit 2 MB/s? Kingston is a good brand, but this one is very disappointing. You’d better look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: peter c

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: The item burned out within two weeks of purchase. It randomly stopped working while transferring some documents. The device was hot to the touch after removing it.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Nelson

customer_reviews.title: As good and bad as every other brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were the cheapest name brand shipped and sold from Amazon. I was hesitant because of all the negative reviews, but the reviews for, it seems, all the usb flash drives seem to be consistently bad with the same issues cited. My experience with these drives has been fast read speeds, disappointingly slow writes speeds. I use them mainly for OS installations so it really doesn't matter to me. We will see how long they will last.
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Sloooooooooooooowwwwwwww
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously slow. I have a SanDisk USB 3.0 drive. It must be ten times faster than this one. I bought three, so I guess I need to test another one to see if I got a dud. But if they are all this slow, they weren't worth the four dollars apiece I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: KY Jamz

customer_reviews.title: Not USB 3.0 Capable
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this could no transfer data at the 3.0 rate - more like 2+ rate. I purchased an HP USB 3.0 drive and it was four times faster. Also, it had only 14.5GB usable memory space. I do not recommend purchasing this USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kugler

customer_reviews.title: Somehow Became Write-Protected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to install Windows To Go. Somehow, in the process, it became write-protected and nothing (not even low-level formatting tools, DISKPART, or registry edit) was able to unprotect it. I returned it for a refund. Nice drive, in theory. No idea why it had this problem. I haven't had that with any other drives.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, you can't buy a better flash drive than KINGSTON!! I even purchased a 2nd one. Owned a 16GB one for years and now I have these two 32GB ones. Put your trust in KINGSTON for sure!! although, it says it comes with a lanyard, mine did not? strange but i'm still happy, drive works fine and comes pre-formatted as FAT32. I re-formatted mine to NTFS to be able to hold larger files and longer file names. ;)
customer_reviews.author: TJ B

customer_reviews.title: Kingston, a trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: It is fast and reliable. I purchased another brand on an "opportunity" sale of the same capacity and in less than 3 months was damaged. Kingston on another hand has been a solid investment.
customer_reviews.author: Cjaviel

customer_reviews.title: It does not fully insert into the USB slot
customer_reviews.text: This USB disk cannot be fully inserted into the USB slot without tweaking, that makes it very hard to use. Also, its dimension is wider so I have to unplug other USB / MiniDP cables that is already plugged in besides the empty USB slot or it will not fully insert. Otherwise it performs fine and priced right.
customer_reviews.author: Tzu En Hu

customer_reviews.title: All files write protected
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 5 months, now all the files are write protected & cannot be changed. Google, "Kingston usb write protected" and you'll see it's not uncommon.
customer_reviews.author: WmBB

customer_reviews.title: Ok for Windows and Linux. Not for FreeBSD or FreeNAS.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. They work fine under Win 7, Win 10 and Ubuntu 18. But are extremely slow under FreeBSD 11.3+ and systems build on FreeBSD 11.3+ core (like FreeNAS), as it has different USB driver not fully compatible to Kingston DataTraveler sticks. Same issue is claimed by other owners of Kingston DataTraveler on FreeBSD and FreeNAS forums.
customer_reviews.author: Dmytro F.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I paid over $20 for this. I got this one because it was USB 3.0 and I have a 3.0 port on my computer so it's supposed to be faster than the 2.0, but this thing is the slowest upload I have ever had. It took me three hours to do 12 GB. My other one (Sandisk USB 2.0) had it done it 40 minutes. Really upset with this and will not be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrinna Maples

customer_reviews.title: Groovy
customer_reviews.text: Bought 7 of these for various use purposes e.g. OS installer/booter, run ESXi, live OS, etc... Solid product worked as expected on Windows and Mac, priced right, recommended!!! Tested read speed 124MBps, write between 19MBps to 24MBps. It took approximately 10 minutes copied 13GB file onto USB stick. Copied from USB stick to Windows desktop took less than 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: 370z

customer_reviews.title: Good 3 pack flash drives but very slow
customer_reviews.text: Not all USB3 drives are made same; This 3 pack is a good value to store operating system for frequent installations, but it has slow transfers, which is a shame for USB 3 technology.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much slower than expected
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive's write speed is much slower than expected. I have an older PNY 64gb USB 3.0 flash drive that is a lot faster and I guess I expected this to be about the same but it isn't. This feels more like 2.0 and I'm a bit disappointed. I probably should have returned it but it was still an okay deal for the storage capacity. I just won't be using it often because of how slow it is.
customer_reviews.author: vertigoelectric

customer_reviews.title: So far its good.
customer_reviews.text: I'll come back near the warranty end time and update review due to other brands not lasting. So far it's working very well and the price was very good for the product.
customer_reviews.author: T. B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice large drive, wish it had a status light
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't paying enough attention to the fact that this drive didn't have a light on it so, if that's important to you, pick another one. However, besides that, it's working just fine for me. I'm currently using it as a drive containing all the system repair tools and OS install .iso files that I could ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Raa'Shaun Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pictures and music never had any trouble
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. I use them to store photos and play music in my car I do not fill and delete fill and delete so I can't speak to that how quick are they I don't know seems to work for me can't beat the price
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: 7 MB/s is Something my 3 Year Old Flash Drive Surpasses
customer_reviews.text: This is complete junk. I have a 960 Pro 512 GB M.2 SSD on my computer with (Sequential Read Speeds up to 3500MB/s and Sequential Write Speeds up to 2100MB/s). When I took a file off of my computer and copied it to the flash drive I was getting speeds around 7-10 MB/s. Pay an extra $5 and get something that is in the 50 MB/s + range. Very disappointing with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Packer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Eh, this was one of the cheapest drives I could find that seemed to have somewhat of a good speed at the time. Noted it certainly isn't amazing and leaves much to be desired but I guess it works for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No longer works for Tesla Dashcam feature
customer_reviews.text: I got this based off of a YouTube review and it worked just fine. No fault of Kingston but Tesla put out an update in July 2019 and it won't put any recording on it anymore because "USB Drive is too slow to save." The 32GB one I got costs less than $6.00 so I doesn't bother me THAT MUCH.
customer_reviews.author: ItsBiju

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Gotthese to put operating systems on so I could try them out before I picked one, and to show my father-in-law the better OS's. These are great for this sort of use. After I will use them for pictures, etc on trips. I would say that Kingston is a good name brand and they have never let me down in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for saving Windows 10 Restore Start Up files!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for saving Windows 10 Restore/Start Up files, which need a minimum of 8GB. I figured, for the money, these 16GB are a pretty good value...they're over the size, but other important files could be stored as well. I just keep this in a safe place for each computer. Thankfully, I haven't needed to use any of them yet since Windows 10 (August 2016 and later) works great with no major problems thus far.
customer_reviews.author: California Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kingston is the BEST
customer_reviews.text: The cheapest USB 3.0 32 gb drive for less than $6.00, what a deal and with Prime free shipping. In addition to that, I never have issue with KINGSTON USB drive, micro-sd....etc
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: What a deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a close out sale for $8.00. Copied all my home pictures on it an put it in a safety deposit box.
customer_reviews.author: Bob0a

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow sequential write
customer_reviews.text: I hoped to use these for macOS install media. This would involve an ~8GB sequential write, and would have taken several hours (at least) to complete :-P Another 32GB USB3 flash drive I have completed the task in about 5 minutes. I can't comment on read speed; I aborted the write process and tossed these devices in the junk box. They _do_ work, and may someday find a home in a less critical niche.
customer_reviews.author: George the Mule

customer_reviews.title: 3.0 storage value
customer_reviews.text: It does what I need it to do and doesn't disappoint in any way. Ideal for bootable Linux, since distros get updated frequently enough. (Side note: I realize that typical bootable Linuces require less than 8 GB. The 16 GB drives are actually cheaper than the 8 GB 1s. Go figure!) There are faster USB 3.0 thumb drives but the price blows anything else out of the water. No cap to lose either.
customer_reviews.author: kingo

customer_reviews.title: Keep fresh copy of Windows 10 on this for security - Plug & play!
customer_reviews.text: USB 3 speed is legit; installs fresh OS in 1--15 mins (vs 1-HOUR w/ DVD).. Price is worth it - NO brick&mortar retail can touch this value. Anyone working on PC's should have the newest version of Win10 on one of these in your kit at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan F.

customer_reviews.title: Handy and economical when files fit
customer_reviews.text: 1. It is not that large storage, but given that this is just for a specific event series of photos, then I know what capacity is, the size of all files, and this is economical to use and give to the ones who asked for them.
customer_reviews.author: An Empty-Nester

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.  Faster than the Kingston Digital DT106 model.
customer_reviews.text: Too wide of body. Fair write speeds for the buck 18.6+ MB/s. Kingston is one of my go to brands for value and reliability. For the price these are good for bootable drive use and such. Buy better for moving files or backing up pics.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Comes up short
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my 32GB Samsung this is 1GB shy. In windows the drive only shows up (30,973,227,008) bytes where my Samsung shows (32,069,559,232) bytes. As far as write speed go 10MB/s is about at fast as large files will transfer. My Samsung is closer to 25MB/s
customer_reviews.author: John B. Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: MP3 player for car.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a MP3 storage device to plug into my wife's car USB slot on a Toyota Highlander. The memory takes a power up every day and used on and off without failure. Value priced and good value.
customer_reviews.author: HandyGuyWithTools

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 64gb but not 64gb. It only has 32gb storage!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 64gb usb drive about 7 months ago. I never realized that it only had 32gb. I know that some manufacturers take some storage space from the device but never this significant. It came brand new in its box and it says 64gb on the usb driver itself but it isn't. I would like to get a new 64gb drive or an exchange or at least a refund.
customer_reviews.author: CHN

customer_reviews.title: decent reads, poor writes
customer_reviews.text: I know these are to be cheap drives, so for $4 i can't complain too much, but these guys are SLOW on writes, saying these are usb 3.0 drives is a joke, as they aren't even usb 2.0 speed limited. if you plan to write to these guys once and then only read from them, i guess they ain't too bad, but it's gonna take ~30 mins to write that 16gb to it.
customer_reviews.author: Breeze

customer_reviews.title: lovely little USB
customer_reviews.text: the geek in me wanted to go bigger, because why not. but the realist in me said no, because id never need it. didn't even need one this big, but it was a great price, and you never know IF you'll need it. so its nice having a large one around just in case.
customer_reviews.author: hoof_hearted4

customer_reviews.title: not 32 gb
customer_reviews.text: unit is only 28 gb,Company takes 4 gb for useless no useable software, Do not buy if you want full 32 gb.Returning for refund or exchange.
customer_reviews.author: the old man

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money - died after couple of uses.
customer_reviews.text: This was a total waste of money. For the few times I used this thing, it ran really hot, and then died after 5 or 6 uses. All the data (mostly personal documents and pictures etc.) resident on it could not be restored and were lost.
customer_reviews.author: N3cr0n0Tr0n

customer_reviews.title: It's really slow
customer_reviews.text: It supposed to be fast, but it is the times slower than my other USB school are supposed to be the same speed.
customer_reviews.author: sol lopez

customer_reviews.title: JUST OKAY
customer_reviews.text: It's a flash drive, it works fine, it holds data. I like that it's relatively small, compact and inconspicuous, but I am not a fan of the design, which has you pulling the two ends apart to close it. It just doesn't open and close fluidly. It's okay, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: goodstuffaloosa

customer_reviews.title: Width of the ISB is prohibitive
customer_reviews.text: The width of the usb is prohibitive if you do not have a port dock or have limited ports which most of the new Mac laptops have. Keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Valentina

customer_reviews.title: Storage is good
customer_reviews.text: Always gotta have extra storage! These drives have proven to be very durable and decently quick. We use them for data backups to give to customers as an inexpensive backup solution. If you love a good slider, this is a great value drive!
customer_reviews.author: CJ P

customer_reviews.title: Very Slow
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very slow flash drive for being a USB 3.0. I spent 11-13 minutes transferring a 5GB file. It’s not my laptop as I own a brand new HP omen.
customer_reviews.author: Arty

customer_reviews.title: Decent Drive
customer_reviews.text: Certain types of files will take a while. It's not a fast drive. But I bought it so that I could transfer folders between computers. So it does the job. However, it's as slow as a USB 2.0 drive.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Talker

customer_reviews.title: Memory is always good
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the uses, it's always good to have these around for file sharing. Bought this brand for the first time and they work and function just as well as my Sandisk, so good investment
customer_reviews.author: Dr Killanger

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Slower that a USB 2.0. Didn't even last 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Paki

customer_reviews.title: Please do not buy!!! Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Fluctuating transfer speed from zero to 20 mb/s. Very slow. Sometimes it gets stuck on zero for 5 seconds and the recovers some speed up to 10 mb/s. Also tested write speed with a couple of old 32 mb (5 years) flashdrives on the same environment (win 10 usb 3.0), and made 20 mb/s flat and the second made 80 mb/s.
customer_reviews.author: carlos morel

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drive now for a few months and it has worked as it is supposed to each time. I didn't buy it for speed, I bought it for music and to transfer files. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Reddex L.

customer_reviews.title: Slow . . .
customer_reviews.text: This Flash Drive is the slowest USB 3.0 drive I have as tested by DiskMark. For comparison I uploaded the DiskMark results compared to a Silicon Power USB 3.0 of equal size. It took over 3 hours to copy 26GB unto this drive. It also doesn't like Mac USB 2.0. Intermittently stops responding when writing large amounts of files.
customer_reviews.author: OlsonBros

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money. Basically use these for music. My kids know the value of all the music I have and grown up with. I may be old, but I saw all the good bands !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robbob

product_meta.title: Kingston 32GB 100 G3 USB 3.0 DataTraveler (DT100G3/32GB)
product_meta.description:
Capacity:32 GB| Style:SingleKingston 32GB USB 3.0 DataTraveler 100 G3.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Kingston's Data Traveler 100 G3 (DT100G3) USB Flash drive is compliant with next-generation USB 3.0 specifications to take advantage of technology in newer notebooks, desktop PCs and digital devices. With DT100G3, storing and transferring of documents, presentations, music, video, and more is quicker and easier than ever. DT100G3 features a sleek, cost-effective design to make the transition to a satisfying USB 3.0 experience a minimal investment. DT100G3 is backward compatible with USB 2.0 and has five-year warranty. Future-proof your portable storage now!
feature_bullets: USB 3.1 Gen 1 (USB 3.0)¹ — DT100 G3 delivers USB 3.0 speeds, Backwards compatible — Can be used with USB 3.0 and 2.0 ports.
Guaranteed - Five-year warranty, free technical support
